body_html: If declaring the class definition is necessary before loading when the full model graph was saved via torch.save(model, ...), then why wouldn't I just save the model state_dict using torch.save(model.state_dict(), ...) ? How the former is different (or beneficial) than the latter ?
body_text: If declaring the class definition is necessary before loading when the full model graph was saved via torch.save(model, ...), then why wouldn't I just save the model state_dict using torch.save(model.state_dict(), ...) ? How the former is different (or beneficial) than the latter ?
body: If declaring the class definition is necessary before loading when the full model graph was saved via ```torch.save(model, ...)```, then why wouldn't I just save the model state_dict using ```torch.save(model.state_dict(), ...)``` ? How the former is different (or beneficial) than the latter ?
